Reviews.Content: 5 star for 3star price We have just returned from staying at this hotel and must say it was a good experience,clean,friendly staff and all for a good price.It was the little extras too,coffee available in the reception area all day plus fruit,while we where there it was satsumas and on top of that there was a basket of biscuits or cakes to choose from too.The kitchenette in the bedrooms is a really good idea even if only used to make a cup of coffee or tea.We followed instructions on how to get to it and found them a little wanting so if you do stay here and are coming from the main Hauptbahnoff(train station),if you stand with your back to the main entrance of the station you will see tram stops infront of you go to the 1st one and catch the number 11tram going from left to right right and get of at osthafenplatz it tells you each stop so don.t panic. Buy your ticket before you get on the tram,there is a information point on the tram platform and they where really bhelpful when we asked them.when you get off the tram walk forward the same way as the tram is going and you will see a pedestrian trafic lights crossing,cross over and walk to the left for about 100 yards ,take the first road right,there is a restaurant on the corner,and the hotel entance is on the end of this road only about 75 yds.We will stay here again and use their partner hotels in other cities in Germany .
Reviews.Author: dunnitall

Reviews.Content: Good hotel but... We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights altogether. Clean hotel even with the smoking room the last few days. Did not smell smoky.Parked on the street even though there is a parking garage (for a fee). Did not have breakfast included so went just down the street and around the corner for coffees and pastries. There is also 2 grocery stores just up the street (Plus and Lidl) and an Esso on the run store. The problem mostly was there are no decent, not too expensive retaurants close by and most restaurants open for Dinner at 6 pm. - a problem if you want to eat earlier. There is one good, not too expensive restaurant about a 10 minute walk away called Das ist Lieber Schon- pizza and pasta- might need to reserve if you go later that 7:00 pm.
Reviews.Author: Mindy53

Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, recommended Hotel in a quiet neighborhood, far from the city center, but 7min to u-bahn. Big room , with kitchenette (big surprise). Staff ok, but not toooo friendly.Overall a BIG surprise. Basically the best 3stars I've seen so far. Warmly recommended. Did not have breakfast but even on Sunday you find bakeries nearby. You can take breakfast for 5-6Eur*** The Pay TV system is tricky. They wanted us to pay even we did not watch paytv. Finally, they understood and canceled that payment. Notify the reception in advance that you do not want paytv.
Reviews.Author: Ciuc

Reviews.Content: Nice if you want to stay for long Some good points:A kitchen with hob, kettle and basic appliances is convenient. Haribo on the pillow.Some bad points:Staff are not the most friendly.Location is a bit far from the city centre.This is a very average hotel.
Reviews.Author: Londoner_8

Reviews.Content: perfectly acceptable perfectley acceptable 3 star accomadation, in a good and safe part of town, quite a trendy, arty area, 2 mins from tram stop straight to the central train station, 5 mins walk to underground with trains direct to main airport, eating and drinking places a few mins from hotel, no bar in hotel but there is an italian restaureant in house very expensive, did'nt eat there, 24 hour checkin, pleasant staff, good housekeeping, spotless if not slightley wornout rooms must be due for a refit soon as it was built 1995,beds not particulally comfotable as the one  pillow is non existant so at chechin ask for an extra 2 pillows each and you will be at least slightley raised up!!! take ear plugs if you intend to sleep with the windows open as the train tracks are a few hundred metres away but not too busy and keep the door that seperates the rest of the appartment from the kitchenette and bathroom door shut , otherwise a howling not dissimiler to a kettle on the boil will keep you awake all night, quite scary!!! probabley would not return but we tend to like to stay in different accomadation each time we visit frankfurt on buisness as it feels more like a break that way unless it is acceptional, fine for a few nights stay
Reviews.Author: fizzengland

Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a decent neighborhood       Hotel room
Reviews.Author: m0909

Reviews.Content: Golden leaf, recommended by me I satyed at the golden leaf based on reviewes in this site and was not disappointed. I was there for 2 nights and payed 54 eu/night via hotels.de (including breakfast which was not rich but sufficient). The staff was polite and helpful.The room was spacious and modern and the kitchenette was very nice to have.It is only about 15 minutes walk from the main shopping street (zeil str.) where the x-mas market was also located. I consider it a good value for money.
Reviews.Author: ilmor

Reviews.Content: Love the Golden Leaf My husband and I spent 10 nights at the Golden Leaf in February of 2007, and had a great time. The Golden Leaf is a little out of the way, but we found the value of the hotel more than made up for the walking distance to the train. The walk to the train was about 15-20 minutes, and a healthful way to start the day. We would deffinately stay again. The room was very comfortable, the street noise minimal, the bathroom very large and the kitchenette a well used convenience. There is a grocery store within a 5-10 minute walk, a great stand up and eat sausage shop across the street (a deffinate must is to try some of the sausage and mustard...absolutely fabulous), and Frankfurt's best pizza at the Devina Lounge. The Devina Lounge was newly opened, and they made us feel right at home. Try their vegetable appetizer.....it was Wunderbar! There's also a fast food type restaurant around the corner, where the staff was extremely helpful. Additionally, there is a liquor store next to the grocery store that sold a huge variety of beer and wine, at incredibly reasonable prices. Within one block, there was also a bakery, a coffee shop, and a Japanese restaurant. Note: Most restaurants close in the area Sundays. Make sure you have what you need for provisions before the shops close. The hotel staff was great. We become ill half way through our trip, and they were able to help us find an Apothecary (pharmacist) for medicines. The staff greeted us warmly every day and was able to easily accomodate our non-smoking room request. We also used the hotel's small, but adequate sauna facilities. Frankfurt was a great city to explore, and a good place to base out of. Day trips to Cologne, the Rhine river, Wurzberg, etc. are all within easy traveling distance on the train. The train station is a lot of fun, and we ate many reasonably priced meals there.
Reviews.Author: ASBURY30

Reviews.Content: Good city hotel. Bad restaurant service. I stayed there for 10 nights, during Worldcup 2006, and it is a good city hotel, with nice bedrooms and good bathroom. It doesn't have air condicioner so it is very hot during summer. The personnel was helpfull, but avoid the restaurant. The personnel at the restaurant are rude with customers. The breakfast is not worse for 11鈧? It is 5 min from city center by taxi, and has the city train very near. It as wifi internet access.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good value for price Not luxurious but comfortable; the hotel is located in a quiet part of town; taxi from the airport will cost you 25-30E but you can make your way there by train and tram if you are not overloaded with baggage !!! There are railroad tracks about 500 meters from the hotel but it did not bother us with undue noise. There does not seem to be any air conditioning in our room which was OK in early April but I don't know in the summer if it gets too hot.The room was clean, the beds were comfortable and space OK, the bathroom was large with a large shower(no bath); there is a fairly complete kitchenette area which we did not really use except for coffee and one late evening when we ordered pizza in from a local restaurant (staff will help you with this)The staff was very nice and helpful; there is a tram station close to the hotel and this will take you to downtown Zeil street (pedestrian in old part of town) in about 15 minutes.There is no internet stations at the hotel. There is a hotel restaurant which appeared to be a concession separate from the hotel ??? OK but nothing special and sort of pricey (100E for spagetti for four and 1 bottle of wine).Downtown Frankfurt has to be seen especially the cathedral which is outstanding; take a boat cruise on the Rhine (Zeil Street tram station) inexpensive and only 50 mins.There is an outlet store close to the hotel (top couturiers) and a major supermarket for wine and food 5 mins away.There is no restaurants to speak of close to the hotel. Some sandwich and coffee shops only.In summary, I would stay there again but inquire about air conditioning in the summer time.
Reviews.Author: renardgris

Reviews.Content: Do your own cooking!       Room 409 with skyline view
Reviews.Author: Gernereiserin

Reviews.Content: Not centrally located hotel with bad breakfast The hotel is very nice.Just some observations. Do not take the offered breakfast. You will be hungry except may be if it is Sunday. You would not find any food but at the gas station in the area, so you may want to spent 11 EUR for actually cereal, a bun with sousages and scrambled eggs with coffee.The rooms with kitchenetts are okay, the good veiw and the access to the garden if you live on the first floor.Nice bathroom, ecpessially the shower.The female staff is not very friendly, so we had to ask twice to fix a lamp in our room and only a male administrator got this done. Thanks to him.The location is not very far from the center, the neibourhood is very quiet. But be prepared to spend time and money to get to the center by metro and a tram.Overall I recommend this hotel, much better then 5 star hotels in Helsinki for example.Good luck
Reviews.Author: Dmitryvulkan
